Based on common knowledge about theatre and French literature in the 17th century, we can make an educated guess that this play is likely set within France. The time period mentioned as `publication_date` indicates when it was published (1678), so it's reasonable to assume the setting of "L'illusion grotesque ou le point nécromancien" also takes place around late 17th century.

In French plays from the Classical era, a common practice is that they are set in either contemporary times or within an idealized version of reality.
